get.description:
Login or sign up with Google by sending an HTTP POST to /api/v2.0/users/oauth/google 
The API consumer is responsible of getting a valid access token from Google.
Login or sign up with Facebook by sending an HTTP POST to /api/v2.0/users/oauth/facebook. The API consumer is responsible of getting a valid access token from Facebook.
Load all my polls. This needs authentication as a logged in user. Note that internally it uses the v2.2 variant of the API!

parameters.name: limited
parameters.description: The apps always set this to false

get.description:
Get all polls of a specific user by sending an HTTP GET to /api/v2.0/users/me/polls with an Accept: xxx header.

Returns the polls the user created and/or the ones he participated in.

consumerType.description: ios-app-2014/15 token - currently returns constant value "officialIOsApp2014-15"

get.description: Gets Doodle calendar ics feed URL

post.description: Adds a calendar feed by ics URL

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: New calendars URL of ics feed

success.description: Indicates if the action was successful

messages.description: Represents error messages, most commonly validation errors

invalidValues.description: Represent values that are causing the errors.

errors.description: Similar as messages, whilst instead of actual message, it contains the problem/cause of the error.

get.description: Initializes the Google Authentication for the specified type (calendars|contacts) by sending back the URL of the Google's account chooser
Initializes the outlook.com Authentication for the specified type (calendars|contacts). Redirects to the outlook.com authorization URL.

parameters.name: adminKey
parameters.description: In the URL query string. Required if you want the poll's comments' authors and texts, or if you want the poll's participants.

parameters.name: participantKey
parameters.description: In the URL query string. A participantKey is set for each invitee of a by-invitation-only poll. Using this parameter, you can retrieve the participant with the corresponding participantKey.

post.description: Create a new poll by sending an HTTP POST to /api/v2.0/polls with an Poll object in the payload

parameters.name: sendLinkEmail
parameters.description: Toggle the sending of the link email to the initiator of the poll. Optional.

get.description: Get the current email/push notification setting of a logged-in user for a given poll by sending an HTTP GET to /api/v2.0/polls/{pollId}/notify-user

put.description: Enable/disable email/push notifications of a logged-in user for a given poll by sending an HTTP PUT to /api/v2.0/polls/{pollId}/notify-user
Enable/disable the initiator's email/push notifications for a given poll by sending an HTTP PUT to /api/v2.0/polls/{pollId}/notify-initiator

get.description: Get links to the Excel and PDF export of a poll by sending an HTTP GET to /api/v2.0/polls/{pollId}/export-links
Get an [ICS/XLS/PDF] export of a poll's final options by sending an HTTP GET to /api/v2.0/polls/{pollId}/export

Get a list of Doodle Premium plans a user can buy/try by sending an HTTP GET to /api/v2.0/subscriptions
If an Access-Token is sent in the HTTP header of the request, this returns the list of plans the currently logged-in user can buy/try.

post.description:
Buy a Premium Doodle plan for a user by sending an HTTP POST to /api/v2.0/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/buy
This method requires an Access-Token to be sent in the HTTP header of the request
Add a participant by sending an HTTP POST to /api/v2.0/polls/{pollId}/participants with a participant object in the payload

parameters.name: adminKey
parameters.description: Required if you want to delete a participant of a hidden or by-invitation-only poll. With the adminKey, any participant can be deleted.

parameters.name: participantKey
parameters.description: Required if you want to delete a participant of a by-invitation-only poll and you don't provide the adminKey.

parameters.name: adminKey
parameters.description: Required if you want to delete a participant of a hidden or by-invitation-only poll. With the adminKey, any participant can be deleted.

get.description:
Get all events of a specific calendar of a specific calendar account from a specific user by sending an HTTP GET to /api/v2.0/users/me/events
This method requires an Access-Token to be sent in the HTTP header of the request
Returns all events by default of the next 30 days of a calendar which is specified with an id as a path parameter.

post.summary: Add a push destination to a user account

201.description: When the new push destination was added to the user

304.description: When this push destination already existed for that user account, empty response

substitution.description: Tags that are used in the email template. (differ in each template)

date.description: Required iff the option is of type DateOption, but spans over multiple days (milliseconds, seconds, minutes and hours are set to 0)

startDate.description: Required iff the option is of type DateOption, but spans over multiple days (milliseconds, seconds, minutes and hours are set to 0)

endDate.description: Required iff the option is of type DateTimeOption (milliseconds and seconds are set to 0)

dateTime.description: Required iff the option is of type DateTimesOption (milliseconds and seconds are set to 0)

startDateTime.description: Required iff the option is of type DateTimesOption (milliseconds and seconds are set to 0)

endDateTime.description: Required iff the option is of type DateTimesOption (milliseconds and seconds are set to 0)

text.description: Required iff the option is of type DateTextOption or TextOption, 1 <= trimmed length <= 128

isFinal.description: When a poll is CLOSED, this indicates if the option is part of the final set of choices (NB: the field in JSON is named "final", not "isFinal" (Java keywords restrictions...))

available.description: Whether the option is available (i.e. someone can still vote for it)

start.description: Required for date options. If allday is true, only the date part (day-month-year) will be considered, not the time part.

end.description: Optional for date options. If allday is true, only the date part (day-month-year) will be considered, not the time part.

allday.description: Whether the date option lasts the whole day, i.e. there is no starting/ending time

userId.description: Contains the user ID of the author, or null if the author was not logged in. Only used when reading comments, ignored when adding or changing a comment.

participant.title: Participant
participant.description:
A participant.
Internally linked to a poll, i.e. a participant is not a standalone object per se.

targetCalendarId.description: A valid calendar id of logged-in user

email.description: Required iff poll.requireEmail, must be valid (there is extensive server-side checking)

phoneNumber.description: Required iff poll.requirePhone, must be valid (there is basic server-side checking)

preferences.description: The answers to the poll's options, 0 = No, 1 = Yes, 2 = IfNeedBe. Required, this list's length must equal poll.options.length

optionsHash.description:
Required to be sent to Doodle when participating in a poll.
This is used by Doodle to prevent participation if a poll's options has been modified in the meantime.

userId.description: Contains the user ID of the participant, or null if the participant was not logged in. Only used when reading participants, ignored when adding or changing a participation.

syncTentatives.description: If true, all the tentative poll options will be synced. If false, only the final poll options will be synced.

pushdestination.title: PushDestination
pushdestination.description: A destination for a push message.

accessToken.description: It must be passed along for every method as a header that needs an authenticated user.

premiumEndDate.description: if set, this indicates when the user's active Premium Doodle subscription ends

timeZone.description:
Time zone used by this user as an Olson database name.
Examples: "Europe/Berlin", "America/North_Dakota/New_Salem"

countryCode.description:
Country of this user. Format is a two-character ISO 3166 country code, upper or lower case.
Examples: "DE", "ch"

language.description:
Language used by the user. Format is a two-character language code.
Examples: "de", "pt", "en"

locale.description:
Locale of the user. Format is a two-character language code plus, optionally, a two-character ISO 3166 country code (upper case), separated by an underscore.
Examples: "de", "pt_BR", "en_GB"

newEmail.description: Use newEmail only for email changes

password.description: NB: password is never set on an user returned by the server.

newPassword.description:
NB: newPassword is never set on an user returned by the server.
Use it only for password change

activationCode.description:
NB: the activationCode is never set in an user returned by the server.
Use it only for user activation (after signup)

notify.description: Specify that this user wants to be notified about a specific poll. Return from the server the result of the request.

enabledCalendars.description: A list of ids for the calendars displayed on the week view (calendar) of the wizard and participation, e.g. to detect calendar conflicts.

targetCalendarId.description: Id of the calendar to sync the tentative or final poll options to.

syncTentatives.description: If true, all the tentative poll options will be synced. If false, only the final poll options will be synced.

invitee.title: Invitee

toBeRemoved.description:
API consumers: use this flag to indicate that an invitee should be removed from the database. 
NB: this flag is never set on an invitee returned by the server, ie the server returns only the non-removed invitees.

adminKey.description: Key used by the poll initiator to gain access to poll administration features (edit poll, close poll, delete participant, ...)

initiated.description: Timestamp indicating when the poll was initiated

inviteesCount.description: Number of invitees of this poll. This can only be read from the server; setting it has no effect.

columnConstraint.description:
Limits the number of participants per option.
A poll can be used as registration form: as soon as the indicated limit has been reached, the respective option is no longer available.

rowConstraint.description:
A participant can only choose rowConstraint options.
Currently, rowConstraint = null allows the selection of all options, whereas rowConstraint = 1 limits the choice to one option per participant. No other values are supported yet.

hidden.description:
With a hidden poll, only the poll initiator can see the answers.
In other words, participation is confidential.

byInvitationOnly.description:
Use this to restrict the participation in the poll only to people that have been invited (by email) by the poll initiator. 
NB: if no invitees are provided during poll creation, this flag is ignored, i.e. it will always be false.

preferencesType.description: Create a Yes/No or a Yes/No/IfNeedBe poll

state.description: A poll's state restrict which actions you can perform on it

locale.description:
Locale of the poll (i.e. of the initiator). Format is a two-character language code (lower case) plus, optionally, a two-character ISO 3166 country code (upper case), separated by an underscore.
Examples: "de", "pt_BR", "en_GB"

options.description:
Poll options are the "questions" the initiator asks the participants.
If the poll has timezone support, dates are absolute points in time, represented as unix timestamps in the JSON, and all options must be of type DateTimeOption or DateTimesOption.
If the poll has no timezone, dates are floating to the user. For data exchange, they are converted to absolute points in time using the GMT-12 time zone, and then represented as unix timestamps in the JSON. To render a human-readable string, interpret the unix timestamp in the GMT-12 timezone.
If the poll type is TEXT, the poll must only have text options.
If the poll type is DATE, the poll must not have text options.

invitees.description:
List of people invited to participate in a "by-invitation" poll.
Be aware that in order to prevent spamming, there is a server-enforced limit to the number of people that can be invited.

askAddress.description: The poll asks for a postal address upon participation

askEmail.description: The poll asks for an email address upon participation

askPhone.description: The poll asks for a phone number upon participation

dateText.description: indicate if a DATE poll contains DateTextOptions (used in Dashboard Polls)

amINotified.description: When a user is provided, it tells if the user should be notified or not for this poll. If no user is provided return false.

evernoteLink.description: A URL to an attached Evernote note

personalMessage.description: A personal message sent for a "by-invitation" poll.

comments.description: A list of comments in this poll

participantsCount.description: Number of participants of this poll. Note that a poll can have more participants than invitees, unless it is a byInvitation poll. This can only be read from the server; setting it has no effect.

initiatorParticipates.description: Set this to true if the poll initiator wants to participate in a poll he created that is by invitation only (byInvitationOnly = true). NB: this field is never set in an user returned by the server.

device.description: Store the device where the poll was created

initiator.title: Initiator
initiator.description: A poll initiator, a.k.a. poll admin. The creator of the poll.

email.description: E-Mail of the poll creator, must be valid (there is extensive server-side checking)

notify.description: Set to true to be notified (by email and push notifications) about the polls created by this initiator.

participantKey.description: participantKey of the initiator will be returned when requesting a poll that was created with the byInvitationOnly and initiatorParticipates flags at true.

timeZone.description: The time zone used by the initiator to create the poll, if any. Always an Olson DB name (e.g. "Europe/Zurich").

id.description: The id of the Premium account (mandator). We use a String representation, as that gives us more flexibility.

domain.description: The domain associated to the Premium account (mandator).

timestamp.description: representing when the first batch of contacts, or the batch of modified contacts was returned

hash.description: hash received representing the currently connected address book accounts (Google, iCloud, etc.)

moreAccounts.description: flag telling if there are more address book accounts to be queried than the one currently being queried

moreContactsInAccount.description: flag telling if there are more contacts to be retrieved from the same address book account

reinit.description: flag telling if all contacts have to be retrieved again
